data.title: Revising the ISSN: involving stakeholders to adapt a bibliographic standard to its ever-changing environment
data.meta_description: Revising the ISSN: involving stakeholders to adapt a bibliographic standard to its ever-changing environment - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. 11 Revising the ISSN Involving stakeholders to adapt a bibliographic standard to its ever- changing environment Open conference of the IFLA standing committee “Serials and Other Continuing Resources” IFLA WLIC, Columbus (Ohio), August 15th, 2016 Clément Oury ISSN International Centre clement.oury <at> issn.org @ISSN_IC

2. 2 Overview of the presentation - The ISSN system today - A necessary revision of the ISSN standard - Issues to be discussed and future steps Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

3. 33 The ISSN system today International Standard Serial Number Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

4. 4 The universe of continuing resources Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016 Continuing resources Serials Newspapers Magazines Periodicals Monographic series Annual reports Blogs Ongoing Integrating resources Websites Databases Loose-leaf Especially scholarly resources or resources with editorial content Dead or Alive!

5. 5 The ISSN network today Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

6. 6 A Register to describe them all - ISSN assignment entails • ISSN number assignment • Construction of the key title (unique in the Register) • Production of the reference bibliographic record o + Following the evolution of the resource through time - All records ingested in the ISSN Register • Maintained by the ISSN International Centre • A total of 1,9 million records • Increase of 75,000 records / year: 30% being online resource - Several access services • ISSN Portal; bulk download of the database, tailored services such as OAI-PMH… Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

7. 7 Why using ISSN? Or: who’s requesting it? - Publishers • Management of their own supply chain; notably for barcodes • Promotion of their content; e.g. necessary for DOI registration, indexing services, DOAJ, etc. - Libraries • Note: ISSN sometimes assigned as part of legal deposit • Reliable identification of purchased/accessed content • Management of physical/digital collections - Service providers, digitization agencies… • For the same reasons Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

8. 88 ISO 3297:2007. A necessary revision? The rise of new stakeholders Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

9. 9 A systematic revision of the standard - ISSN: a standard established in 1975 • Within ISO TC46 (information and documentation) / SC9 (identification and description) • 4 revisions since 1975 - Latest revision: 2007 • Clarification of scope • Creation of ISSN-L Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016 Print 0362-4331 ISSN-L 0362-4331 Online 1553-8095 CDROM 1542-667X

10. 10 New stakeholders - The evolution of publishing industry • Open access publishing • Social media – altmetrics - New metadata providers • Publishers, discovery services • Critical role of EDItEUR / ONIX - New bibliographic models and rules • The FR-something acronyms: FRBR, FRAD, FRSAD, FRBROO, FRBR-LRM • RDA Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

11. 11 New identifiers - Identifiers: the corner stones of the Web of Data - ISO TC46/SC9 standards: a growing family • Newcomers: ISTC, DOI, ISNI, ISCI, ISLI • Already existing members – good as new: ISBN, ISMN, ISRC • Some cousins too! E.g. ORCID - Rethinking the place of ISSN in the identifiers ecosystem Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

12. 1212 Issues to be discussed From ISSN IC point of view! Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

13. 13 Scope of ISSN assignment - ISSNs for digital publications: what is a “different edition”? • Influence of ISBN definition of edition? Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016 +DRMs… Online 1553-8095

14. 14 Granularity of ISSN assignment Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016 Online 1538-3687 Print 0003-9942 Archives of Neurology (Chicago) 1960-2012 Online 2168-6157 Print 2168-6149 JAMA Neurology 2013-… Online 2330-9644 Print 0375-8540 A.M.A. Archives of Neurology 1959-1960 ISSN-L 0003-9942 ISSN-L 2168-6149ISSN-L 0375-8540 Meta-ISSN: XXXX-XXXX ? Issue XXXX-XXXX/YYYY ? Article: XXXX-XXXX/YYYY/ZZZZ ? - Higher level: meta- ISSNs for a title through time? - Lower level: influence of NISO/PESC?

15. 15 Interactions with other stakeholders - With other identification agencies • Ensuring the consistency between identification systems • Preventing overlaps and “dead angles” - With the publishing industry • To ensure that the ISSN system still fit their needs • To facilitate the ingest of external data - With the producers and users of linked data • To promote the ISSN as a reference identifier in the Linked Open Data Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016

16. 16 When do we start? - Vote on systematic revision launched on April 2016 • Results to be announced in September - IF the results are positive: - Duration of the revision process: 24 to 48 months • Examples of the ISBN revision: almost finished, 3-years duraton - Looking for a representative Working Group • Members from publishing, libraries, IT domain - Interested participants to contact their ISO national body • Note: only TC46/SC9 P-members countries allowed to nominate experts Revising the ISSN standard - Clément Oury - IFLA WLIC - Columbus, Ohio - August 15th, 2016
